com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FMultiTextfieldInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
      • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FContainer
        • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FMultiTextfieldInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FMultiComponent

    public class FMultiTextfieldInput
extends FContainer
    This component creates rows of textfields with expand (symbol: +) and contract (symbol: -) buttons. The first row only has an expand button, once an additional row is created, each row has an expand and contract button. The first row cannot be removed.
    Author:
    Marcel Risch, ts, aeb

    • Constructor Detail

      • FMultiTextfieldInput

        public FMultiTextfieldInput(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.String value)
        The constructor, which initializes the textfields and buttons. It creates the first row, which consists of a textfield and an expand button.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of this component.
        value - A value parameter, which is part of the ID of the textfields.
        page - The page on which the components will be registered

    • Method Detail

      • getAllEditRows

        public java.util.List<FComponent> getAllEditRows()
        returns all FComponents that contain payload (i.e. all components but the buttons with + and -)

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int rows)
        convenience to create rows number of input rows. Depending on the FComponent used for editing later, the contents can then be set using getAllEditRows()

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.util.List<java.lang.String> options)
        Clears existing rows and adds new ones corresponding go the specified options. Implications: if given options are null or empty, rows will simply be cleared (equivalent to clearValue())
        Parameters:
        options -

      • setValueAndRefresh

        public void setValueAndRefresh(java.util.List<java.lang.String> options)

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.lang.Object value,
          java.lang.Integer row)
        Creates a row using the Triple object. The first element is the input field, followed by an expand button, followed by a contract button. The value is the value displayed, the row is the row in which it will be displayed.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the row. May be null.
        row - The row in which the element should be displayed. If it is null, the new object will be placed on the bottom of the list.

      • addRow

        public java.lang.String render()
        Description copied from class: FContainer
        draw the HTML anchors of the kids - populate view will be triggered from the page since the components are all registered. The specific implementation should override this method since it only providers a very basic layout

      • returnValuesAsStrings

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> returnValuesAsStrings(boolean removeEmptyStrings)
        This method returns the inputs as Strings. This is useful for input fields where the user enters text.
        Returns:
        All non-empty strings.
